name: Sarah Morroney
text: This place has great pizza and I‚Äôm never disappointed in my meal. A whole pizza and a drink for $10 is a good price, especially for quality food. The staff is super friendly and helpful. Service can get a little slow around rush hours ‚Ä¶More

name: David Daniels
text: First time to MOD.  Got a 11" meat lovers.  Switched spicey sausage from mild.  Overall a decent slice, not too much flop, not too greasy.  Also has the hot honey finishing.  Nice amount of sweet and heat.  I would come back.  Nothing special about the staff.

name: Premal Vora
text: I first had a Mod pizza a few years ago while I was attending a conference in downtown Seattle. It was quite good. I was delighted to find out that we now have our own Mod outlet. ‚Ä¶More

name: LEVAR F
text: Pizza was delicious! Tried the thin crust, I will definitely be going back to try varieties.

name: Maya J
text: This was my first physical visit in MOD. As soon as I entered the establishment I was greeted warmly and inviting. The customer service was impeccable and the staff answered all questions I had. I was helped by Wendell he also along with each team member made my son and I super bow Sunday awesome!

name: Lee Thomas
text: By far, the BEST BEST PIZZA EVER!!!  Excellent customer service! Our all time favorite yummiest place!

name: Meg Lydie
text: I love MOD as an overall company but this is probably the worst location I have ever been to. there was no energy coming from anyone and not a single employee looked like they wanted to be there. it took almost 10 minutes for someone to ‚Ä¶More

name: Chrissy Shea
text: I really wanted to like it but we won't be back. One of our pizzas was made wrong and I was doubted when I said it wasn't the right one. I had to literally ask for them to make a new one... The guy just kind of stood there like I was lying ‚Ä¶More

name: Amanda Motes
text: Love the food and the staff! My boyfriend and I came to MOD to get lunch this week and once we reached the counter to pay, he realized he left his wallet at my house. We called and had his card information texted over so we could pay, but ‚Ä¶More

text: Good pizza, crispy on bottom

name: Alvin Carter

name: Jr Jones
text:
They are a good pizza spot love the Pizza, but it's not fair that they are not getting there hazard pay they are riskin there lives too.
I have a son that works at Wawa in Downingtown and he said everyone has got there's so why not Mod. Come on upper management do better

name: Many Me
text: Delicious and made just the way I wanted!

name: Anna Foster
text: Pizza is always pretty consistent, service was really slow today but it was an off time, and the staff was super pleasant.

name: Richard Anastasi
text: Friendly staff, tasty food, and good prices. A lot like a chipotle but for pizza instead of burritos. They also have a few salads to choose from.

name: Dan K
text:
I love Mod Pizza and can't wait for the Downingtown location to open!
Update: I went their opening weekend and I was very impressed with the decor, staff, and food. As always the store was uniquely designed, the staff was very ‚Ä¶More

text: I don't think I will ever get tired of this place. It is consistently delicious and the BYO pizza is full of options.

name: M3TRO BOLT
text: Pizza was good for the price mega dough was filling kind workers and good staff altogether 5/5 staff 5/5 taste 5/5 for timing altogether 100% rating I‚Äôm satisfied

name: lauren ash
text: The people here are extremely friendly and welcoming, HOWEVER, I went here last night and was immediately disturbed. The young man working with the pizza dough was wearing a cloth type of friendship bracelet thing, without wearing gloves, ‚Ä¶More

name: Warren Nelson
text: Excellent pizza, excellent service.

name: Greg B
text: Went when they had been opened for 2 weeks. They charged $1.50ish for fountain water. When I asked why the manager said he would not only refund me for the water; but refund me for my whole meal because I was charged for a bottle of water. ‚Ä¶More

name: Karen Stephenson
text: I love the Pizza! It's so fresh and so delicious, I love that you can pick your toppings.

name: Mr.C Lo
text: Love this place 1 price unlimited toppings ...my go to is the mad dog with my own twist and fig drizzled on top.

name: Karen
text: Don't waste your time, go to snap pizza in main Street Exton instead. The cheese tastes strangely weird and they burnt the pizza crust and  underneath too. That's all I could taste when reading this pizza.

name: Beulah Medley
text: Tried to enjoy my pizza. But i think it was a little burnt on the bottom.. I will try it again maybe next time not cooked as long

name: Karen Whitlock
text: Great place! The staff is VERY friendly and so helpful!! We‚Äôll be back!

name: Danielle
text: Their no name cakes(dessert) is soooo good. Their pizzas are okay. Not as much of topping selections as I would like. Last time I was there, it was pure chaos. Long wait, messed up orders, didn't even have proper change! They had to use the tip jar to make change for people and this was at 7pm.

name: Michael Sypniewski
text: Tried this place for the first time and it's a little pricey but totally worth the money.

name: margaret march
text: Love their pizza- made to order and thin crust !

text: Fast service, great pizza! We got the Mod size Mad Dog and the Maddy and both were great!

text: First time to MOD pizza, Monica and her team are great. Will be going back, would recommend to other people

name: Erik Noska
text: Love the mod, wish they would open one closer to me

name: Bex
text: I really like this place! Good food and friendly people :) I like that you can customize your pizza too

name: Catherine Advincula
text: My favorite is the Mad Dog pizza and vanilla shake. I was so excited to find out when they opened in Downingtown. I was one of the first 50 customers who went to Mod Pizza when they opened on Nov. 5th, and I got a free pizza. The staff are friendly and very respectful.

name: Steven Motes
text: Was looking for a low carb option. Saw that they had a cauliflower crust. It was very good, but when I checked the nutrition information, I was shocked and disappointed to find out their cauliflower crust has 84 net carbs! That's hardly low ‚Ä¶More
